content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice regexp exercice. There is a difference between flooring and rounding numbers in test/validators, but there is at least one normal test that uses rounding, so it should be good.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cette contribution est tr√®s bien, il s'agit d'un challenge math√©matique simple et sympatique

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice task. I think you should add 'Shortest' mode as well.

Goal section
* Please explain the format of the input map.

* Please add:
All the [[temperature]]s on the map are integers.

Input section
* Please add "<<Line 1>>: An integer" in front of the first description.

* Please fix the typo: Heigth => Height

* Please format "Next [[N]] Lines" in <<bold>>, and add a colon after it.

Output section
* Please format "No data" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Constraints section
* Please format "Temperature" as a [[variable]] and change "T" to "t".

Cases
* Suggest a greater variety of temperatures (including more single-digit positive/negative and zero temperatures) in the last pair of cases.

Thanks.

Good idea, maybe precise that each temperature is an Integer, and give some clues about N "size"

Maybe too hard for reverse mode

Thanks for your input.

Reverse mode doesn't look too hard to me.
Looking at the input you can easily guess that you have to parse the numbers in it.
As for the average, I would say that's pretty common and not too hard to guess.

Thanks for your input.
I have implemented the changes you suggested.

Thank you for making the changes. Below are my comments on the revised version:

Goal section
* Please format * as a {{constant}}, and also mention the border which consists of {{+}}, {{-}} and {{|}}.

Input section
* Please change the comma to a colon.

Constraints section
* Please format * as a {{constant}}.

Cases
* Please add one or more zero temperatures to the last validator.

Thanks again.
Good, but the line that you've modified is now one character short üòõ
Good catch, everything should be good now!
